title: Sonny Carter Navy Files

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Navy personnel file (service jacket) for Manley Lanier "Sonny" Carter, Jr., M.D., who died in a plane crash in April 1994: https://www.nasa.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/167748main_fs_nbl508c.pdf?emrc=67e772.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Standard Operating Procedures number 2006/05-FS-001: FSU/Global Positioning System

title: Enforcement Data: Tennessee Lawful Employment Act (HB 1378)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Enforcement Data: Tennessee Lawful Employment Act (HB 1378)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dates: 2011 - present (broken out by year).

- Total number of tips or complaints received related to employer noncompliance with E-Verify mandates. 

- Total number of investigations and/or audits conducted on employers for E-Verify compliance. 

- Total number of warnings issued to employers for E-Verify noncompliance. 

- Total number of civil fines issued for E-Verify noncompliance. 

- Total dollar amount of civil fines collected in the "lawful employment enforcement fund."

- Total number of cases prosecuted against employers for E-Verify noncompliance. 

If a particular metric is not available/applicable, please proceed with the available data (or the most similar metric).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Michael Macher.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Enforcement Data: Tennessee Lawful Employment Act (HB 1378)
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover,

§T.C.A. 10-7-503(a)(2)(A) makes public records available to citizens of the state of Tennessee. The same act permits the records custodian to require photo identification, issued by a governmental entity that includes the person's address. This enables the record custodian to confirm the requestor's status as a citizen of Tennessee.
Please submit a photo of a valid State of Tennessee identification so the agency can proceed with preparing the estimated cost to fulfill your request.
Best regards,

[cid:image001.png@01DB81FB.891A05C0]
Chris Cannon | Chief Communications Officer
Assistant Commissioner, Communications and Events Division
220 French Landing Drive – 4A
Nashville, TN 37243
615-253-4251

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Enforcement Data: H.B. 56 (Beason-Hammon Alabama Taxpayer and Citizen Protection Act)
communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dates: 2011 - present (broken out by year).

- Total number of tips or complaints received related to employer noncompliance with E-Verify mandates.

- Total number of investigations and/or audits conducted on employers for E-Verify compliance.

- Total number of warnings issued to employers for E-Verify noncompliance.

- Total number of civil fines issued for E-Verify noncompliance.

- Total dollar amount of civil fines collected from employers found in violation of E-Verify mandates.

title: Sunshine Law Request: Clearview AI

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sunshine Law Request: Clearview AI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Clearview AI, Inc. that were active any time between 1/1/2023 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to Clearview AI, Inc. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format.
- A copy of all training materials, including but not limited to any handouts, workbooks, assessments, presentations, slides, videos, audio files, or other materials, either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A copy of all agency manuals either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A copy of all agency policies and procedures either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A roster of all agency employees who either had or currently have a user account for Clearview AI, Inc. products or had or currently have internal agency permissions to use Clearview AI, Inc. products any time between 7/1/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- A roster of all agency employees who have completed agency training for the use of Clearview AI, Inc. products any time between 7/1/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

When an invoice is sent to you for payment, payment must be received immediately.  If payment is not received in an allotted amount of time we will freeze all future requests until all unpaid invoices are paid in full and up to date. communications.subject: General Records Request :: R443899-021725
communications.communication:
Dear e e: 
 
The Broward Sheriff's Office received a public records request from you on February 17, 2025, seeking the following: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Clearview AI, Inc. that were active any time between 1/1/2023 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to Clearview AI, Inc. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format.
- A copy of all training materials, including but not limited to any handouts, workbooks, assessments, presentations, slides, videos, audio files, or other materials, either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A copy of all agency manuals either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A copy of all agency policies and procedures either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of Clearview AI, Inc. products.
- A roster of all agency employees who either had or currently have a user account for Clearview AI, Inc. products or had or currently have internal agency permissions to use Clearview AI, Inc. products any time between 7/1/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- A roster of all agency employees who have completed agency training for the use of Clearview AI, Inc. products any time between 7/1/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbroward-county-sheriff-782%252Fsunshine-law-request-clearview-ai-181606%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAbyrwObOfNC4kTXxqOtoKGgyY%3A1tkDbp%3AP4gPy-Zcx3Zel67Sc25MXnYQu256sRlLwCnsTzQKp4A 
Your request was assigned a reference number R443899-021725 and is being processed in the order in which it was received. 
 
The Broward Sheriff’s Office is committed to providing records as quickly and efficiently as possible. Please note, as a result of an increase in workload and current staffing, our unit is experiencing a backlog of requests for public records. We appreciate your patience as we’re working diligently to fulfill requests in the order in which they are received. Please DO NOT make a duplicate request for a copy of your report/record as this could further delay the turnaround time. 
 
Thank you. 
 
Broward Sheriff's Office 
Public Records Unit

title: July 17, 2022 Greenwood Park Mall Shooting Request (Johnson County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: July 17, 2022 Greenwood Park Mall Shooting Request (Johnson County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

•Bodycam Footage in the mall and of the search at the suspect’s residence
•Crime scene photos
•Contents at the suspect’s residence 
•Photos of the interior of the suspect’s residence 
•Witness statements
•CCTV footage at the mall
•Contents of the Suspect’s phone
•Photos of the suspect’s social media
•Any photos of the suspect that haven’t been released, even photos years prior to the shooting 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you regard any of the requested records as subject to exemption from required disclosure under the law, I hereby request that you exercise your discretion and disclose them nonetheless.

If you decide to withhold any requested records, please do not deny the entire request and release information available under the law. If you cannot fulfil certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after reducing or removing these portions claimed to be exempt. I ask you to explain why the portion had to be redacted and what was redacted.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. 

Sincerely,

James Ferguson

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Marcus Jordan Arrest [February 4, 2025]

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Marcus Jordan Arrest [February 4, 2025]
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Marcus Jordan on February 4, 2025.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: February 4, 2025
Location: Maitland, Florida
Suspect: Marcus Jordan, age 34
Incident Summary: Marcus Jordan, son of Michael Jordan, was arrested near Orlando for DUI with property damage, possession of cocaine, and resisting an officer after fleeing a traffic stop. Officers responded to a report of a damaged Lamborghini stuck on railroad tracks, where they found Jordan and his passenger. Jordan was later arrested after field sobriety tests.

I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who interacted with Marcus Jordan during this incident, including footage from the vehicle approach, arrest, and transportation to the station.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Your Request to Palm Beach Gardens Police Department
communications.communication:
Good morning, 
  
 Your request for body camera video has been received on the above-referenced case. This case is a DUI with a crash involved. Please review the current Florida State Chapter 119 Public Records Laws in reference to crash report information: 
  
 “As a condition precedent to accessing a crash report, a person must present a valid driver’s license or other photographic identification, proof of status or identification that demonstrates his or her qualifications to access that information, and file a written sworn statement with the state or local agency in possession of the information stating that information from a crash report made confidential and exempt by this section will not be used for any commercial solicitation of accident victims, or knowingly disclosed to any third party for the purpose of such solicitation.” Section 316.066(2)(d), F.S. 
  
 If you qualify under the Florida Statute to have access to the crash information, the estimated cost for the footage is $188.86. Please complete, notarize, and return the form if applicable so I can begin processing your request. Unless a notarized crash affidavit indicating a legitimate reason to your involvement in this case is provided, this case will be closed. 
  
 HSMV Form 94010 Sworn Statement for Crash Report 
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Kelsey Olsowski
Digital Evidence Technician
Palm Beach Gardens Police Dept.
10500 N. Military Trail
Palm Beach Gardens FL 33410

communications.subject: Records Request Confirmation PD2025-193
communications.communication:
Our office is in receipt of your request for information/records. 
  
 As such, the same will be forwarded to the respective departments for review/response. 
  
 As soon as our Office receives the responsive information/records, we will provide them accordingly. 
  
 
Your request security key is 2924F7E8.
Your request reference number is Request Number: PD2025-193.

Please have this security key and reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 *Please be assured your request will be addressed in the order in which it was received and will be produced within a reasonable amount of time. Should this request rise to the level of “extensive” the City will provide you with a written estimate, of which a deposit must be paid, prior to commencement.  
  
 Please be advised of the statutory obligation of the custodian of public records is to provide access to, or copies of, public records in a reasonable period of time, under reasonable conditions, and under supervision by the custodian or the custodian's designee. However, Florida statutes do not require the custodian of records to provide information about the records produced or to create new records in response to a request. 
  
 The City is happy to comply with your request, should you require additional assistance, please let us know. 
  
 Thank you,

title: Body Camera Footage of Alicia Moore’s Arrest and Car Fire (May 26, 2023)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Body Camera Footage of Alicia Moore’s Arrest and Car Fire (May 26, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all body-worn camera footage related to the May 26, 2023, incident involving Alicia Moore at the Dillard’s store in Oviedo Mall.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: May 26, 2023
Location: Dillard’s, Oviedo Mall, Oviedo, FL
Suspect: Alicia Moore (26 years old)
Incident Summary:
Moore was reportedly shoplifting inside Dillard’s for about an hour, accompanied by a male companion.
During this time, her vehicle caught fire with her children inside.
Good Samaritans rescued the children, who were covered in soot and one of whom suffered first-degree burns.
Firefighters arrived and extinguished the car fire, but the vehicle was completely destroyed.
Police and paramedics responded to the scene, and Moore was arrested for aggravated child neglect.

Requested Footage:
All body-worn camera footage from officers who:
Responded to the car fire and interacted with witnesses.
Spoke with and arrested Alicia Moore.
Recorded Moore’s reaction upon exiting Dillard’s and seeing the fire.
Interviewed the good Samaritans who rescued the children.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Body Camera Footage of Mark Roher’s Arrest (January 18, 2024)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Body Camera Footage of Mark Roher’s Arrest (January 18, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to body-worn camera footage related to the January 18, 2024, arrest of Mark Roher at Boca Lago Country Club in Boca Raton, Florida.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: January 18, 2024
Location: Boca Lago Country Club, Boca Raton, FL
Suspect: Mark Stuart Roher (52 years old)
Incident Summary:
Roher was involved in an altercation at a wedding buffet over the prime rib carving station.
He allegedly smashed a plate over another guest’s head after an argument about children skipping the line.
A large brawl ensued, with multiple guests reportedly getting involved.
Roher claimed he was the real victim and insisted that another guest kicked him.
Bodycam footage reportedly captures Roher:
Complaining about being arrested and stating: "I want to press charges against him."
Invoking his right to remain silent but later admitting he initiated the conflict.
Telling deputies: "I don't think it's right that you're parading me in front of them."
Witnesses, including a waiter at the venue, confirmed that Roher struck the victim with a plate.
Roher was charged with aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and later released on $1,000 bond.
His next court date is scheduled for February 20, 2024.
Requested Footage:
Bodycam footage from all officers who:
Responded to the scene at Boca Lago Country Club.
Interacted with or arrested Mark Roher.
Recorded Roher’s statements regarding the incident.
Transported Roher to jail or processed him at the station.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all available body-worn camera footage related to the May 3, 2023, arrest of Amandeep Singh following a fatal DUI crash that killed two 14-year-old boys in Long Island, New York.

Date: May 3, 2023
Location: Long Island, NY
Suspect: Amandeep Singh (36 years old)
Incident Summary:
Singh was driving a Dodge Ram pickup truck the wrong way when he crashed into an Alfa Romeo carrying four teenage tennis players.
Two 14-year-old victims, Drew Hassenbein and Ethan Falkowitz, were killed on impact.
The other two teenage passengers survived with injuries.
Singh attempted to flee the scene and hid in a dumpster before being apprehended by police.

Requested Footage:
Bodycam footage from all officers who:
- Located and arrested Amandeep Singh near the dumpster.
- Conducted Singh’s initial questioning at the scene.
- Administered sobriety tests or breathalyzer.
- Transported Singh to jail or processed him at the station.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Public Records Request – Body Camera Footage of Bree Ann Gadoury’s Arrest (May 11, 2024)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Body Camera Footage of Bree Ann Gadoury’s Arrest (May 11, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting, under Florida Public Records Law, access to all available body-worn camera footage related to the May 11, 2024, arrest of Bree Ann Gadoury (42 years old) near East State Road 100 and Aviation Drive for resisting arrest and aggravated battery on a law enforcement officer.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: May 11, 2024
Location: Near East State Road 100 and Aviation Drive, Bunnell, FL
Suspect: Bree Ann Gadoury (42 years old)
Incident Summary:
Deputies were dispatched after reports of a woman on a bicycle recklessly weaving in and out of traffic, nearly causing collisions.
Before deputies arrived, she keyed multiple vehicles.
When approached, Gadoury fled into a grassy field and actively resisted arrest.
While struggling with deputies, she attempted to stab an officer in the leg with a sharp Fix-a-Flat tool.
A Taser was deployed to subdue her.
She continued resisting by using her legs to block officers from placing her in the patrol car.
She was ultimately charged with:
Fleeing with intent to elude law enforcement
Resisting an officer with violence
Aggravated battery on a law enforcement officer
Two counts of criminal mischief
Requested Footage:
bodycam footage from responding deputies capturing:
The initial traffic stop attempt on the bicycle
The pursuit and struggle in the grassy field
The attempted stabbing with the Fix-a-Flat tool
Deployment of the Taser
Transport and resistance inside the patrol car

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this request under for access to all available body-worn camera footage related to the March 25, 2024, arrest of Amber McCann at the Palm Coast Walmart for grand theft ($750–$5,000) and drug-related charges.

To assist in locating the footage, here are key details of the incident:

- Date: March 25, 2024
- Location: Walmart, Palm Coast, Florida
- Suspect: Amber McCann (30 years old)
Incident Details:
A concerned citizen reported McCann shoplifting inside Walmart.
She allegedly filled a shopping cart with over $1,000 worth of merchandise and attempted to leave without paying.
Deputies confronted her in the parking lot, where she claimed she was playing a “game” called “21” involving stealing as much as possible without getting caught.
She first claimed to put the stolen items in a random car, then later admitted the vehicle was a rental linked to her boyfriend.
Deputies recovered the stolen merchandise from the vehicle, along with glass pipes, marijuana, methamphetamine, and other drugs.
A safe containing silver bars, copper bars, and a platinum bar was also found in the trunk.
McCann was arrested and charged with grand theft and multiple drug offenses.
The arrest was recorded on body camera and dashcam footage.
I am specifically requesting:

Body-worn camera footage from all deputies involved, including McCann’s initial detainment and questioning in the parking lot.
Footage of the search of the vehicle, including the discovery of stolen items and narcotics.
Dashcam footage capturing any additional statements made by McCann while inside the patrol car.
Any other publicly releasable footage related to the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: USS Liberty: Copy of DoD Mandated Investigation of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Copy of DoD Mandated Investigation of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a survivor of the June 8, 1967 Israeli attack on the USS Liberty and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association. [https://ussliberty.org]

On June 8, 2005 the USS Liberty Veterans Association submitted “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967” to the Secretary of the Army in his capacity as Executive Agent for the Secretary of Defense. 

A copy of that report is at https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25497919-war-crimes-report-with-exhibits/.

The Department of Defense Law of War Manual requires “DoD policy has required that the commander of any unit that obtains information about a reportable incident shall immediately report the incident through the applicable operational command and Military Department.” [Paragraph 18.13.2, DoD Law of War Manual Page 1100]

The footnote on page 1100 states in part, “All reportable incidents committed by or against U.S. personnel, enemy persons, or any other individual are reported promptly, investigated thoroughly, and, where appropriate, remedied by corrective action.”

The DoD Law of War Manual is at https://dod.defense.gov/Portals/1/Documents/pubs/DoD%20Law%20of%20War%20Manual%20-%20June%202015%20Updated%20Dec%202016.pdf.

An excerpt of the relevant passage in the Law of War Manual is attached.

A reportable incident committed against U.S. personnel was reported to the Flag and other high-ranking US Navy officers serving on the US Navy Court of Inquiry when USS Liberty survivor Lloyd Painter testified under oath during the US Navy Court of Inquiry that he witnessed the IDF torpedo boats deliberately machine gunning of life rafts we had dropped over the side in anticipation of abandoning ship.

Upon receiving a copy of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report, Painter noted that the portion of his testimony referenced above does not appear in the Report of the Court.

In his sworn deposition, Painter writes:

“1515 Hours: I climbed the ladder and opened the hatch to the main deck. I wanted to see if it was safe enough to bring the wounded sailors out onto the main deck. What I saw sent ice running through my veins. The life rafts were either destroyed or had been cut loose and had floated away. I personally observed an Israeli MTB methodically machine gun one of the Liberty's empty life rafts that had been cut loose and was floating in the water. I knew at that split second that the thrust of the IDF attack was to kill every American sailor on board. There were to be no survivors that day. I decided to leave all of the wounded sailors below decks for some measure of protection. I did not prepare to abandon ship.”

We have attached a complete copy of Lloyd Painter’s sworn deposition to this request.

We are requesting a copy of the investigation of the War Crimes investigation that is mandated by the Department of Defense Manual.

We are further requesting a copy of all records related to or mentioning our submission of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”

WE ARE NOT ASKING FOR ANOTHER COPY OF A US NAVY COURT OF INQUIRY REPORT BUT FOR THE REPORT OF THE MANDATED INVESTIGATION, CONDUCTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOD LAW OF WAR MANUAL, ESTABLISHED TO INVESTIGATE AND RESOLVE THE ALLEGATIONS CONTAINED IN OUR WAR CRIMES REPORT WHICH WE SUBMITTED TO THE DOD ON JUNE 8, 2005.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Aggregate Juvenile Data

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Aggregate Juvenile Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I’m seeking collected criminal data of convicted and adjudicated juvenile sex offenders. To avoid any unwarranted invasions of privacy, I’m specifically seeking the de-identified, aggregate data annually from January 1, 2020, through January 1, 2025, including the following: 
   1. The number of adolescent offenders, as well as juvenile offenders, including those granted youthful offender status, under the age of 18 at the time of the offense.
   2. Offender demographics including: total arrest dispositions, age at the time of offense, race, gender, and county convicted/adjudicated.
   3. If collected in the same data, demographics of the victim including: age, gender, and race.
   4. If collected in the same data, number of petitions filed and status (approved/denied/in progress). 
I ask that, if possible, you provide any potentially responsive records as an electronic spreadsheet or searchable database format. Should you deny this request in whole or in part, I ask that you detail your reasons for doing so in writing, citing the applicable statutes.
This information is being sought in the regular course of newsgathering on behalf of the Toni Stabile Center for Investigative Journalism for dissemination to the general public. 
I’m requesting that you waive any fees associated with production of potentially responsive records. Release of this information is in the public interest because it will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations and activities, specifically how the state and local authorities work together to monitor sex offender status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Maria Guinnip.

title: Aggregate Juvenile Data

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Aggregate Juvenile Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I’m seeking collected criminal data of convicted and adjudicated juvenile sex offenders. To avoid any unwarranted invasions of privacy, I’m specifically seeking the de-identified, aggregate data annually from January 1, 2020, through January 1, 2025, including the following: 
   1. The number of adolescent offenders, as well as juvenile offenders, including those granted youthful offender status, under the age of 18 at the time of the offense.
   2. Offender demographics including: total arrest dispositions, age at the time of offense, race, gender, and county convicted/adjudicated.
   3. If collected in the same data, demographics of the victim including: age, gender, and race.
   4. If collected in the same data, number of petitions filed and status (approved/denied/in progress). 
I ask that, if possible, you provide any potentially responsive records as an electronic spreadsheet or searchable database format. Should you deny this request in whole or in part, I ask that you detail your reasons for doing so in writing, citing the applicable statutes.
This information is being sought in the regular course of newsgathering on behalf of the Toni Stabile Center for Investigative Journalism for dissemination to the general public. 
I’m requesting that you waive any fees associated with production of potentially responsive records. Release of this information is in the public interest because it will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations and activities, specifically how the state and local authorities work together to monitor sex offender status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Maria Guinnip.
